channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for LA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for LA

item.title: Report I-2024080072
item.description:
Report I-2024080072

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-23T15:14:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-07
  • City: Port Allen
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 8/7/2024 1 pallet of UN 1789 Hydrochloric Acid(Muriatic Acid) was sitting in the SEFL BTR OS&D Bay. The pallet containing 84 boxes with 2 each 1 gallon bottles inside collapsed& fell over. The pallet collapsing caused an estimated 10 gallons to spill on the dock. The spill was contained by dock associates. SEFL Safety was contacted, and contacted Hazmat 1 spill response. E3/OMI arrived on site at approximately 9:15. The team accessed the situation& proceeded with the clean up process. Clean up was complete at approximately 13:30. In total 10-55 gallon drums were used to contain the waste.E3/OMI will return to pick up the waste drums at a later date, once approval has been received.

  • Description: On Aug 13th a package was found to be leaking during offloading of the container. The package contained UN1263 Paint, 3 PGIII. The package was contained into a steel salvage drum and is awaiting disposition.

item.title: Report E-2024080340
item.description:
Report E-2024080340

Identified by scraper @ 2024-08-19T21:12:43+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-08-05
  • City: ST ROSE
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: E3OMI was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractorâ€™s arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted two (2) 3ft-by-2ft area of the trailer floor and the concrete floor and estimated that one (1) gallon of material was released due to forklift damaging two (2) 5-gallon metal pails. E3OMI personnel deployed absorbent pads to recover the released material. E3OMI personnel placed the two (2) damaged pails into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum and the spent absorbent pads, impacted cardboard and PPE into one (1) additional 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location prior to the contractor demobilization. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.
